segment.source: Release Notes for App-V 5.0 SP3
segment.target: Release Notes for App-V 5.0 SP3

segment.source: Release Notes for App-V 5.0 SP3
segment.target: Release Notes for App-V 5.0 SP3

segment.source: Release Notes for App-V 5.0 SP3
segment.target: Release Notes for App-V 5.0 SP3

segment.source: The following are known issues in Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 SP3.
segment.target: The following are known issues in Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 SP3.

segment.source: Server files fail to get deleted after a new App-V 5.0 SP3 Server installation
segment.target: Server files fail to get deleted after a new App-V 5.0 SP3 Server installation

segment.source: If you uninstall the App-V 5.0 SP1 Server and then install the App-V 5.0 SP3 Server, the installation fails and the wrong version of the Management server is installed.
segment.target: If you uninstall the App-V 5.0 SP1 Server and then install the App-V 5.0 SP3 Server, the installation fails and the wrong version of the Management server is installed.

segment.source: The following errors are displayed:
segment.target: The following errors are displayed:

segment.source: The issue occurs because the Server files are not being deleted when you uninstall App-V 5.0 SP1, so the App-V 5.0 SP3 installation process erroneously does an upgrade instead of a new installation.
segment.target: The issue occurs because the Server files are not being deleted when you uninstall App-V 5.0 SP1, so the App-V 5.0 SP3 installation process erroneously does an upgrade instead of a new installation.

segment.source: Workaround: Delete the following registry key before you start installing App-V 5.0 SP3:
segment.target: Workaround: Delete the following registry key before you start installing App-V 5.0 SP3:

segment.source: Querying AD DS can cause some applications to work incorrectly
segment.target: Querying AD DS can cause some applications to work incorrectly

segment.source: When you receive updated packages by querying Active Directory Domain Services for updated group memberships, it can cause some applications to work incorrectly if the applications depend on the user’s access token.
segment.target: When you receive updated packages by querying Active Directory Domain Services for updated group memberships, it can cause some applications to work incorrectly if the applications depend on the user’s access token.

segment.source: In addition, frequent group membership queries can cause the domain controller to overload.
segment.target: In addition, frequent group membership queries can cause the domain controller to overload.

segment.source: For more information about user access tokens, see Access Tokens.
segment.target: For more information about user access tokens, see Access Tokens.

segment.source: Workaround: Wait until the user logs off and then logs back on before you query for updated group memberships.
segment.target: Workaround: Wait until the user logs off and then logs back on before you query for updated group memberships.

segment.source: Do not use the registry key, described in Hotfix Package 2 for Microsoft Application Virtualization 5.0 Service Pack 1, to query for updated group memberships.
segment.target: Do not use the registry key, described in Hotfix Package 2 for Microsoft Application Virtualization 5.0 Service Pack 1, to query for updated group memberships.

segment.target: Got a suggestion for App-V?

segment.target: For App-V issues, use the App-V TechNet Forum.
